bugs.title: CVE-2022-1586 mingw-pcre2: pcre2: Out-of-bounds read in compile_xclass_matchingpath in pcre2_jit_compile.c [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-1586 mingw-pcre2: pcre2: Out-of-bounds read in compile_xclass_matchingpath in pcre2_jit_compile.c [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-1586 pcre2: Out-of-bounds read in compile_xclass_matchingpath in pcre2_jit_compile.c

long_desc.thetext:
An out-of-bounds read was discovered in PCRE version 10.39, related to a missing Unicode property matching issue in JIT compiled regular expressions. The bug is present in the function "compile_xclass_matchingpath", declared in "pcre2_jit_compile.c".

References:

https://github.com/PCRE2Project/pcre2/commit/50a51cb7e67268e6ad417eb07c9de9bfea5cc55a

Created pcre2 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2077987]

Created mingw-pcre2 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2081957]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9

Via RHSA-2022:5251 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:5251

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2022:5809 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:5809

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2022-1586

bugs.title: CVE-2022-1587 mingw-pcre2: pcre2: Out-of-bounds read in get_recurse_data_length in pcre2_jit_compile.c [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-1587 mingw-pcre2: pcre2: Out-of-bounds read in get_recurse_data_length in pcre2_jit_compile.c [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-1587 pcre2: Out-of-bounds read in get_recurse_data_length in pcre2_jit_compile.c

long_desc.thetext:
An out-of-bounds read was discovered in PCRE version 10.39, affecting recursions in JIT-compiled regular expressions. The bug is present in the function "get_recurse_data_length", declared in "pcre2_jit_compile.c".

References:

https://github.com/PCRE2Project/pcre2/commit/03654e751e7f0700693526b67dfcadda6b42c9d0

Created pcre2 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2077986]

Created mingw-pcre2 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2081976]

I've submitted an upstream issue to find out which commits really fix the CVE

https://github.com/PCRE2Project/pcre2/issues/122

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9

Via RHSA-2022:5251 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:5251

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2022-1587
